actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend section 214 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide a deduction for dependent care expenses for married taxpayers who are employed part time, or who are students, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Provides under the Internal Revenue Code, a tax deduction for dependent care expenses for married taxpayers who are employed part time, or who are students. Sets limits on such deductions Prohibits a reduction in such deduction (for dependent and household care services necessary for gainful employment) by the amount of income or payments received by an incapacitated spouse or dependent. (Amends 26 U.S.C. 214).

titles.title: A bill to amend section 214 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide a deduction for dependent care expenses for married taxpayers who are employed part time, or who are students, and for other purposes.
